cards.name: Cowardice
cards.text: Whenever a creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, return that creature to its owner's hand. (It won't be affected by the spell or ability.)
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, return that creature to its owner's hand. (It won't be affected by the spell or ability.)

cards.name: Crafty Pathmage
cards.text: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.
cards.flavor:
Follow the pathmage
—Otarian expression meaning
"escape quickly"

rulings.text: If you increase the power of the targeted creature after the ability resolves, it still can't be blocked that turn.

cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less is unblockable this turn.

cards.name: Daring Apprentice
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Daring Apprentice: Counter target spell.
cards.flavor: In front of every great wizard is a doomed apprentice.
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Daring Apprentice: Counter target spell.

cards.name: Dehydration
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.

cards.name: Dream Prowler
cards.text: Dream Prowler can't be blocked as long as it's attacking alone.
cards.flavor:
"To think that some find sleep a restful state."
—Volrath
cards.originalText: Dream Prowler is unblockable as long as it's attacking alone.

cards.name: Evacuation
cards.text: Return all creatures to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor: Which is more unsettling: the roar of battle or the silence that follows?
cards.originalText: Return all creatures to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Exhaustion
cards.text: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during their next untap step.
cards.flavor: Tired doesn't even begin to cover it.

rulings.text: The creatures and lands are only prevented from untapping during the targeted player's next untap step. They can still can untap during other player's untap steps.
No creatures or lands controlled by the player will untap during their next untap step. This includes those which entered the battlefield after Exhaustion resolved.

cards.originalText: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during his or her next untap step.

cards.name: Fishliver Oil
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has islandwalk. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has islandwalk. (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls an Island.)

cards.name: Fleeting Image
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{1}{U}: Return Fleeting Image to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Beware lest you lose the substance by grasping at the shadow."
—Aesop, Fables, trans. Jacobs
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
{1}{U}: Return Fleeting Image to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Flight
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has flying. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Fugitive Wizard
cards.flavor: The College of Lat-Nam is often forced to expel students whose experiments grow too risky or too cruel.

cards.name: Horned Turtle
cards.flavor: It doesn't like having visitors . . . unless it's having them for lunch.

cards.name: Imaginary Pet
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have a card in hand, return Imaginary Pet to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: "It followed me home. Can I keep it?"

rulings.text: Imaginary Pet's ability triggers only if you have cards in your hand as your upkeep begins, and the ability checks again as it resolves. If your hand is empty at both those times, Imaginary Pet stays on the battlefield.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have a card in hand, return Imaginary Pet to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Levitation
cards.text: Creatures you control have flying.
cards.flavor: Barrin's pride in his apprentice was diminished somewhat when he had to get the others back down.
cards.originalText: Creatures you control have flying. (They can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Lumengrid Warden
cards.flavor: His peers derive knowledge from ancient tomes locked within dark spires. He finds knowledge within the solitude of a lifetime spent watching the Quicksilver Sea.

foreignNames.name: ルーメングリッドの管理人

cards.name: Mahamoti Djinn
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.
cards.originalText: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Mana Leak
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.
cards.flavor: The fatal flaw in every plan is the assumption that you know more than your enemy.
cards.originalText: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.

cards.name: Mind Bend
cards.text: Change the text of target permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another or one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "nonblack creature" to "nongreen creature" or "forestwalk" to "islandwalk." This effect lasts indefinitely.)

rulings.text: Alters all occurrences of the chosen word in the text box and the type line of the given card.
Can target a card with no appropriate words on it, or even one with no words at all.
It can't change a word to the same word. It must be a different word.
It only changes what is printed on the card (or set on a token when it was created or set by a copy effect). It will not change any effects that are on the permanent.
You choose the words to change on resolution.
You can't change proper nouns (i.e. card names) such as "Island Fish Jasconius".
It can be used to change a land's type from one basic land type to another. For example, Forest can be changed to Island so it produces blue mana. It doesn't change the name of any permanent.

cards.originalText: Change the text of target permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another or one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "nonblack creature" to "nongreen creature" or "forestwalk" to "plainswalk." This effect doesn't end at end of turn.)

cards.name: Phantom Warrior
cards.text: Phantom Warrior can't be blocked.
cards.flavor:
"There are as many pillows of illusion as flakes in a snow-storm. We wake from one dream into another dream."
—Ralph Waldo Emerson, "Illusions"
cards.originalText: Phantom Warrior is unblockable.

cards.name: Plagiarize
cards.text: Until end of turn, if target player would draw a card, instead that player skips that draw and you draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Are you thinking what I'm thinking?"

rulings.text: If you target yourself, this spell has no useful effect. It will not cause an infinite loop since a replacement effect can't modify the same event more than once. This effect will not modify the draw that it has you perform.
You draw the card from your library as normal, not from your opponent's library.

If you and your opponent each cast Plagiarize on each other during the same turn, the two spells effectively cancel each other out. You will draw cards when you normally would and so will your opponent.

If you target a player whose library is empty, any effect or turn-based action that would cause that player to draw a card will cause you to draw a card instead. It doesn't matter that the other player would be unable to draw.

cards.originalText: Until end of turn, if target player would draw a card, instead that player skips that draw and you draw a card.

cards.name: Polymorph
cards.text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller reveals cards from the top of their library until they reveal a creature card. The player puts that card onto the battlefield, then shuffles all other cards revealed this way into their library.

rulings.text: If there are no creatures in the player's library, then the target creature is still destroyed, you see all the cards in that player's library, and then they shuffle and continue play.
If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Polymorph would resolve, the entire spell doesn't resolve. Nothing else happens.
If there are no creature cards in the player's library, all the cards in that library are revealed, then the library is shuffled. (The targeted creature remains destroyed.)
A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.
If the targeted creature has indestructible, it's still a legal target — it just isn't destroyed. The rest of Polymorph's effect happens as normal.

cards.originalText: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a creature card. The player puts that card into play and shuffles all other cards revealed this way into his or her library.

cards.name: Puppeteer
cards.text: {U}, {T}: You may tap or untap target creature.
cards.flavor: "Getting people to do what you want is merely a matter of telling them what they want to hear."

rulings.text: You decide on resolution whether or not to tap or untap the creature.

cards.originalText: {U}, {T}: Tap or untap target creature.

cards.name: Reminisce
cards.text: Target player shuffles their graveyard into their library.
cards.flavor: Leave the door to the past even slightly ajar and it could be blown off its hinges.

rulings.text: This card won't be put into your graveyard until after it's finished resolving, which means it won't be shuffled into your library as part of its own effect.

cards.originalText: Target player shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library.

cards.name: Remove Soul
cards.text: Counter target creature spell.
cards.flavor: When your enemies are denied soldiers, they are denied victory.

rulings.text: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

cards.originalText: Counter target creature spell.

cards.name: Rewind
cards.text: Counter target spell. Untap up to four lands.
cards.flavor: "Let's go over this one more time. . . ."

rulings.text: Rewind targets only a spell. It doesn't target any lands. The lands are chosen as Rewind resolves.
You can choose up to four lands, no matter who controls any of them. Those lands untap once. You can't choose one land and have it untap four times, for example.

If the spell is an illegal target when Rewind tries to resolve, perhaps because it was countered by another spell or ability, Rewind won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won't untap any lands.
If Rewind resolves but the target spell can't be countered, you'll still untap lands.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell, then untap up to four lands.

cards.name: Sage Aven
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Sage Aven enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
When Sage Aven comes into play, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

cards.name: Sea Monster
cards.text: Sea Monster can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
cards.flavor: It's easy to believe the monster is a myth—until you feel three hundred thousand pounds of myth crashing down on your ship.
cards.originalText: Sea Monster can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

cards.name: Sea's Claim
cards.text:
Enchant land (Target a land as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that land.)
Enchanted land is an Island.
cards.flavor:
"Who's the crazy one now!?"
—Torgle, mountaintop boatmaker
cards.originalText:
Enchant land (Target a land as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that land.)
Enchanted land is an Island.

cards.name: Sift
cards.text: Draw three cards, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: Dwell longest on the thoughts that shine brightest.
cards.originalText: Draw three cards, then discard a card.

cards.name: Sleight of Hand
cards.text: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.
cards.flavor:
"Gambling with mages never is."
—Remin, venerable monk

rulings.text: If there is only one card in your library, it goes to your hand.

cards.originalText: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Storm Crow
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Storm crow descending, winter unending. Storm crow departing, summer is starting.
cards.originalText: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Telepathy
cards.text: Your opponents play with their hands revealed.
cards.flavor: "Secrets? What secrets?"
cards.originalText: Your opponents play with their hands revealed.

cards.name: Temporal Adept
cards.text: {U}{U}{U}, {T}: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"If yesterday was two days ago tomorrow, will the day after tomorrow be today or yesterday?"
—Temporal Manipulation 101 final exam,
Tolarian Academy
cards.originalText: {U}{U}{U}, {T}: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Thieving Magpie
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Thieving Magpie deals damage to an opponent, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Other birds collect twigs for their nests. Magpies steal jewels for theirs.
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
Whenever Thieving Magpie deals damage to an opponent, you draw a card.

cards.name: Thought Courier
cards.text: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: "There's an assortment to satisfy all your needs: deep, fleeting, dirty, pure, scientific, philosophical, after, and even fore. For a price."
cards.originalText: {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.

cards.name: Tidal Kraken
cards.text: Tidal Kraken can't be blocked.
cards.flavor: To merfolk, pirates are a nuisance. To pirates, merfolk are a threat. To the kraken, they're both appetizers.
cards.originalText: Tidal Kraken is unblockable.

cards.name: Tidings
cards.text: Draw four cards.
cards.flavor:
"Though the letter was many pages long, I could tell all I needed to know from one look at the messenger's face."
—Barrin, master wizard
cards.originalText: Draw four cards.

cards.name: Time Ebb
cards.text: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor: Like the tide, time both ebbs and flows.
cards.originalText: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.

cards.name: Trade Routes
cards.text:
{1}: Return target land you control to its owner's hand.
{1}, Discard a land card: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: The wise, the righteous, the mighty—the merchant feeds them all.
cards.originalText:
{1}: Return target land you control to its owner's hand.
{1}, Discard a land card: Draw a card.

cards.name: Traumatize
cards.text: Target player puts the top half of their library, rounded down, into their graveyard.
cards.flavor: You won't know what you're missing.

rulings.text: The player can put the cards in their graveyard in any order they choose.

cards.originalText: Target player puts the top half of his or her library, rounded down, into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Treasure Trove
cards.text: {2}{U}{U}: Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Wealth means power; the power to subdue, to crush, to exploit, the power to enslave, to outrage, to degrade."
—Emma Goldman, "Anarchism"
cards.originalText: {2}{U}{U}: Draw a card.

cards.name: Wanderguard Sentry
cards.text: When Wanderguard Sentry enters the battlefield, look at target opponent's hand.
cards.flavor: It allows those with dangerous weapons to pass. But not those with dangerous thoughts.
cards.originalText: When Wanderguard Sentry comes into play, look at target opponent's hand.

cards.name: Wind Drake
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"But high she shoots through air and light,
Above all low delay,
Where nothing earthly bounds her flight,
Nor shadow dims her way."
—Thomas Moore, "Oh that I had Wings"
cards.originalText: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Withering Gaze
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You draw a card for each Forest and green card in it.
cards.flavor: "Nature cares not for the knowledge to be gained from its study. Better to bleed it dry, lest its potential be wasted on lizards and leaves."
cards.originalText: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You draw a card for each Forest and green card in it.

cards.name: Zur's Weirding
cards.text:
Players play with their hands revealed.
If a player would draw a card, they reveal it instead. Then any other player may pay 2 life. If a player does, put that card into its owner's graveyard. Otherwise, that player draws a card.

rulings.text: If someone pays the cost, then the card was never drawn or discarded. It just gets put into the graveyard directly from the library.
This is a continuous replacement effect that modifies a draw.
If a spell or ability causes more than one card to be drawn, draw the cards one at a time and deal with this replacement before drawing the next card.

When using Dredge with this, you have two choices. You can immediately replace the draw with Dredge, or you can apply Zur's Weirding's replacement. If the latter, you first resolve Zur's Weirding's ability, then if you're going to draw the card, decide whether or not to replace that draw with Dredge.

cards.originalText:
Players play with their hands revealed.
If a player would draw a card, he or she reveals it instead. Then any other player may pay 2 life. If a player does, put that card into its owner's graveyard. Otherwise, that player draws the card.

cards.name: Blackmail
cards.text: Target player reveals three cards from their hand and you choose one of them. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor: In addition to killing peasants, punishing subordinates, and raising an army of nightmares, Braids somehow found time for her favorite hobby: petty extortion.

rulings.text: If the player has less than 3 cards, all of them are revealed.

cards.originalText: Target player reveals three cards from his or her hand and you choose one of them. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Bog Imp
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Think of it as a butcher knife with wings.
cards.originalText: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Bog Wraith
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor: The bodies of its victims are the only tracks it leaves.
cards.originalText: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

cards.name: Coercion
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor: "Of all I that I have lost, I miss my mind the most."
cards.originalText: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. Choose a card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Consume Spirit
cards.text:
Spend only black mana on X.
Consume Spirit deals X damage to any target and you gain X life.
cards.flavor:
"Your blood, your marrow, your spirit—all are mine."
—Mayvar, minion of Geth

rulings.text: The amount of life you gain is equal to the number chosen for X, not the amount of damage Consume Spirit deals (in case some of it is prevented).
If the targeted permanent or player is an illegal target by the time Consume Spirit would resolve, the entire spell doesn't resolve. You won't gain any life.

cards.originalText:
Spend only black mana on X.
Consume Spirit deals X damage to target creature or player. You gain X life.

cards.name: Contaminated Bond
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature attacks or blocks, its controller loses 3 life.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature attacks or blocks, its controller loses 3 life.

cards.name: Cruel Edict
cards.text: Target opponent sacrifices a creature.
cards.flavor:
"No mockeries now for them; no prayers nor bells, / Nor any voice of mourning save the choirs,— / The shrill, demented choirs of wailing shells."
—Wilfred Owen,
"Anthem for Doomed Youth"
cards.originalText: Target opponent sacrifices a creature.

cards.name: Dark Banishing
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"Ha, banishment? Be merciful, say 'death,'
For exile hath more terror in his look,
Much more than death."
—William Shakespeare, Romeo and Juliet
cards.originalText: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Death Pits of Rath
cards.text: Whenever a creature is dealt damage, destroy it. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"Neither could I forget what I had read of these pits—that the sudden extinction of life formed no part of their most horrible plan."
—Edgar Allan Poe,
"The Pit and the Pendulum"

foreignNames.name: Pozos de la muerte de Rath

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature is dealt damage, destroy it. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Deathgazer
cards.text: Whenever Deathgazer blocks or becomes blocked by a nonblack creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
cards.flavor: Your entire life passes before its eyes.
cards.originalText: Whenever Deathgazer blocks or becomes blocked by a nonblack creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

cards.name: Diabolic Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: The best ideas often come from the worst minds.
cards.originalText: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Drudge Skeletons
cards.text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor:
"The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, never surrender, and don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off."
—Nevinyrral, Necromancer's Handbook
cards.originalText: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.name: Enfeeblement
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets -2/-2.
cards.flavor:
"If it is weak, either kill it or ignore it. Anything else honors it."
—Kaervek
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets -2/-2.

cards.name: Execute
cards.text:
Destroy target white creature. It can't be regenerated.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Any fool who would die for honor is better off dead."
—Cabal Patriarch
cards.originalText:
Destroy target white creature. It can't be regenerated.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Fear
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.flavor:
"Don't fear the darkness. Fear what it hides."
—Remin, venerable monk
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

cards.name: Festering Goblin
cards.text: When Festering Goblin dies, target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: In life, it was a fetid, disease-ridden thing. In death, not much changed.
cards.originalText: When Festering Goblin is put into a graveyard from play, target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Final Punishment
cards.text: Target player loses life equal to the damage already dealt to that player this turn.
cards.flavor: The pain of a lifetime—every scrape, illness, and bruise—condensed into a single moment.

rulings.text: Damage that is prevented does not count toward the total.

cards.originalText: Target player loses life equal to the damage already dealt to him or her this turn.

cards.name: Foul Imp
cards.text:
Flying
When Foul Imp enters the battlefield, you lose 2 life.
cards.flavor: The imp, unaware of its own odor, paused to catch its breath . . . and promptly died.

rulings.text: You can cast this if you have less than 2 life, since the life is lost as an effect and not a payment.

cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
When Foul Imp comes into play, you lose 2 life.

cards.name: Giant Cockroach
cards.flavor: Toren had stepped on a lot of bugs during his life, so he couldn't help feeling embarrassed when a bug stepped on him.

cards.name: Gluttonous Zombie
cards.text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.flavor: Greed and gluttony led him to death. Now they are his greatest assets.
cards.originalText: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

cards.name: Grave Pact
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control dies, each other player sacrifices a creature.
cards.flavor:
"The bonds of loyalty can tie one to the grave."
—Crovax, ascendant evincar

rulings.text: Each other player sacrifices a creature for each creature you control that goes to a graveyard.

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature you control is put into a graveyard from play, each other player sacrifices a creature.

cards.name: Gravedigger
cards.text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.

rulings.text: A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

cards.originalText: When Gravedigger comes into play, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Hell's Caretaker
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

rulings.text: Hell's Caretaker can be the creature sacrificed to activate its ability, but it can't be the target of its own ability.

The upkeep step is before the draw step, after the untap step. Because the turn has already begun, creatures put onto the battlefield during your upkeep won't be able to attack or pay a {T} cost this turn.

cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Return target creature card from your graveyard to play. Play this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Highway Robber
cards.text: When Highway Robber enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: "Tonight, madam, it's your money and your life."
cards.originalText: When Highway Robber comes into play, you gain 2 life and target opponent loses 2 life.

cards.name: Hollow Dogs
cards.text: Whenever Hollow Dogs attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A hollow dog is never empty. It is filled with thirst for the hunt.

rulings.text: If it attacks more than once per turn, it gets the bonus each time.

cards.originalText: Whenever Hollow Dogs attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Horror of Horrors
cards.text: Sacrifice a Swamp: Regenerate target black creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a Swamp: Regenerate target black creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.name: Hypnotic Specter
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Hypnotic Specter deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.

rulings.text: The ability triggers even if the Specter's damage is being redirected to an opponent. It does not trigger if damage that would have been dealt to the opponent is redirected to a nonopponent player or a creature, or if the damage is prevented.

cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
Whenever Hypnotic Specter deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.

cards.name: Looming Shade
cards.text: {B}: Looming Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: On darkness feeding, in nightmares breeding.
cards.originalText: {B}: Looming Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Lord of the Undead
cards.text:
Other Zombie creatures get +1/+1.
{1}{B}, {T}: Return target Zombie card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: "I confer with Death itself. What could you possibly do to injure me?"

rulings.text: Lord of the Undead now has the Zombie creature type and its first ability has been reworded to affect *other* Zombies. This means that if two Lord of the Undead are on the battlefield, each gives the other a bonus.

cards.originalText:
Other Zombies get +1/+1.
{1}{B}, {T}: Return target Zombie card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Megrim
cards.text: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to that player.
cards.flavor:
"You can run from your pain, but you will tire before it does."
—Gerrard of the Weatherlight
cards.originalText: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to that player.

cards.name: Mind Rot
cards.text: Target player discards two cards.
cards.flavor:
"The beauty of mental attacks is that your victims never remember them."
—Volrath
cards.originalText: Target player discards two cards.

cards.name: Mindslicer
cards.text: When Mindslicer dies, each player discards their hand.
cards.flavor: It is the thing that goes bump in the night.
cards.originalText: When Mindslicer is put into a graveyard from play, each player discards his or her hand.

cards.name: Mortivore
cards.text:
Mortivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards.
{B}: Regenerate Mortivore.
cards.originalText:
Mortivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards.
{B}: Regenerate Mortivore. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.name: Nantuko Husk
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Nantuko Husk gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
The soul sheds light, and death is its shadow. When the light dims, life and death embrace.
—Nantuko teaching

rulings.text: You can sacrifice Nantuko Husk itself to activate its own ability. However, the only thing that will do is put Nantuko Husk into the graveyard.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature: Nantuko Husk gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Nekrataal
cards.text:
First strike
When Nekrataal enters the battlefield, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. That creature can't be regenerated.

rulings.text: Nothing happens if there are no nonartifact, nonblack creatures on the battlefield when Nekrataal enters the battlefield, but if there is one, you must target it, even if it's a creature you control.

cards.originalText:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
When Nekrataal comes into play, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. That creature can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Nightmare
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
cards.flavor: The thunder of its hooves beats dreams into despair.

rulings.text: If you control 0 swamps, then the Nightmare has 0 toughness and will be put into its owner's graveyard as a state-based action right before the next player gains priority.
Nightmare's power and toughness changes as the number of Swamps you control changes.
The ability that defines Nightmare's power and toughness works everywhere, not just on the battlefield.
Nightmare's ability counts all lands you control with the subtype Swamp, not just ones named Swamp.

cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.

cards.name: Persecute
cards.text: Choose a color. Target player reveals their hand and discards all cards of that color.
cards.flavor:
"Of all the tyrannies on humane kind
The worst is that which persecutes the mind."
—John Dryden,
"The Hind and the Panther"

rulings.text: The color is chosen on resolution.

cards.originalText: Choose a color. Target player reveals his or her hand and discards all cards of that color.

cards.name: Phyrexian Arena
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
cards.flavor: A drop of humanity for a sea of power.

foreignNames.name: ファイレクシアの闘技場

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.

cards.name: Phyrexian Gargantua
cards.text: When Phyrexian Gargantua enters the battlefield, you draw two cards and you lose 2 life.
cards.flavor: Other Phyrexians have nightmares about the gargantua.

foreignNames.name: ファイレクシアのガルガンチュア

cards.originalText: When Phyrexian Gargantua comes into play, you draw two cards and you lose 2 life.

cards.name: Plague Beetle
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor: No one knows whether they were named for the disease they carry or for the speed at which they multiply.
cards.originalText: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

cards.name: Plague Wind
cards.text: Destroy all creatures you don't control. They can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"The second wind of ascension is Reaver, slaying the unworthy."
—Keld Triumphant
cards.originalText: Destroy all creatures you don't control. They can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Raise Dead
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: The earth cannot hold that which magic commands.

rulings.text: You must show the card you bring out of the graveyard to your opponent.
The creature being brought back is chosen on announcement and not on resolution of the spell because it is targeted.

cards.originalText: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Ravenous Rats
cards.text: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
cards.flavor: Nothing is sacred to the rats. Everything is simply another meal.
cards.originalText: When Ravenous Rats comes into play, target opponent discards a card.

cards.name: Razortooth Rats
cards.text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.flavor:
"Men and rats both hunger: we for our playthings; they, for us."
—Crovax, ascendant evincar
cards.originalText: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

cards.name: Royal Assassin
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.flavor: Trained in the arts of stealth, royal assassins choose their victims carefully, relying on timing and precision rather than brute force.

rulings.text: Can't target itself because you choose the target before you tap him. At that time he is not yet a legal target.
If the creature is no longer tapped when the Assassin's ability resolves, then the ability doesn't resolve.

cards.originalText: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.

cards.name: Scathe Zombies
cards.flavor:
"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,
Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;
It had been strange, even in a dream,
To have seen those dead men rise."
—Samuel Taylor Coleridge,
"The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

cards.name: Sengir Vampire
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.
cards.flavor: Empires rise and fall, but evil is eternal.

rulings.text: If Sengir Vampire deals nonlethal damage to a creature and then a different effect or damage source causes that creature to be put into a graveyard later in the turn, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger and it will get a +1/+1 counter.

Each time a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, check whether Sengir Vampire had dealt any damage to it at any time during that turn. If so, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger. It doesn't matter who controlled the creature or whose graveyard it was put into.
If Sengir Vampire and a creature it dealt damage to are both put into a graveyard at the same time, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger, but it will do nothing when it resolves.

cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn is put into a graveyard, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.

cards.name: Serpent Warrior
cards.text: When Serpent Warrior enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.
cards.flavor: They are incubated by swamp gases and cut their teeth on zombie flesh. Serpent warriors are not to be trifled with.

rulings.text: You can cast this if you have less than 3 life, since the life is lost as an effect and not a payment.

cards.originalText: When Serpent Warrior comes into play, you lose 3 life.

cards.name: Slay
cards.text:
Destroy target green creature. It can't be regenerated.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: The elves had the edge in guile, skill, and valor. But in the end, only sheer numbers mattered.

rulings.text: You don't draw a card if this spell is countered.

cards.originalText:
Destroy target green creature. It can't be regenerated.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Soul Feast
cards.text: Target player loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.
cards.flavor: You are who you eat.
cards.originalText: Target player loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.

cards.name: Spineless Thug
cards.text: Spineless Thug can't block.
cards.flavor: What it lacks in backbone, it makes up for in cruelty.
cards.originalText: Spineless Thug can't block.

cards.name: Swarm of Rats
cards.text: Swarm of Rats's power is equal to the number of Rats you control.
cards.flavor:
"Rats, rats, rats! Hundreds, thousands, millions of them, and every one a life."
—Bram Stoker, Dracula
cards.originalText: Swarm of Rats's power is equal to the number of Rats you control.

cards.name: Underworld Dreams
cards.text: Whenever an opponent draws a card, Underworld Dreams deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.flavor:
"In the drowsy dark cave of the mind, dreams build their nest with fragments dropped from day's caravan."
—Rabindranath Tagore

rulings.text: If multiple cards are drawn at once, this card triggers once for each card drawn.
In a multi-player game, it affects all opponents.

cards.originalText: Whenever an opponent draws a card, Underworld Dreams deals 1 damage to him or her.

cards.name: Unholy Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.
cards.flavor: Such power grows the body as it shrinks the soul.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.

cards.name: Will-o'-the-Wisp
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{B}: Regenerate Will-o'-the-Wisp. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.)
{B}: Regenerate Will-o'-the-Wisp. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
